#365DAYS project

Two days ago, I've decided to start a #365days photography project. The idea is simple - each day for the next 365 days I am to take a photo and share it on Instagram. In order to keep the entire thing in order, I've created some rules by which I need to comply:

1. All the photographs must be taken with my phone and all the edits must be done on my phone as well.

2. Each photograph taken on a given day must also be edited and shared on Instagram on that same day, ie. between 00:00 and 23:59 (12AM and 11:59PM). Photographs taken on any other day cannot be used.

3. There is no restriction on the subject of the photographs but it best be visually engaging and not be forced or thoughtless.

4. Documenting reality is not a primary goal. More important is the visual aspect of the photographs so all forms of color-, exposure-, and effect-based post processing are acceptable (along with cropping, rotating and adjusting perspective) but doctoring is not.


What I hope to achieve with this project:

1. Motivate myself to take more photos and take them more regularly.

2. Push myself to look for photo opportunites and enhance my creative thinking.

3. Better my technical skills.

4. Establish a larger portfolio.

5. Build an audience for my photography.


See you in 365 days!


EDIT: Oh, and I almost forgot about this:

6. Have fun ;)
